etymologies: Middle English: via Old French desert, from deservir ‘serve well’ (see deserve)

notes.text: People who get their just deserts get what they deserve. Deserts here is related to deserve, and is spelled with one -s- in the middle. This usage has no relation to the dessert course of a meal, yet the -ss- spelling (just desserts) is found in the Oxford English Corpus nearly as often as the correct spelling

definitions: a person's worthiness or entitlement to reward or punishment

examples.text: the penal system fails to punish offenders in accordance with their deserts

shortDefinitions: what person deserves with regard to reward or more usually punishment
